alert.note: Alert for Bullock; Montgomery; Pike (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 12:48PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike, western Bullock and southeastern Montgomery Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 1246 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms near Troy Municipal Airport, or 10 miles north of Troy, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Troy, Meadville, Pike Road, Pine Level, Kent, Dublin, Linwood, Shopton, Ansley, Troy Municipal Airport, High Ridge, Carters Hill, Orion, China Grove, Mitchell and Currys. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
